result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley E Ottow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ashley E Ottow is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ashley E Ottow was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Ashley E Ottow was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 37 days credit, if revoked.

Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Count 4 and Case 14CF834.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation if Agent deems appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to contact Probation by 09:00 a.m. on 11-11-2014.

Count 1 is dismissed out right.
Case 14CF1266 is dismissed and read in.

Defendant Ashley E Ottow in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel presents bail arguments. State objects. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Attorney Fragoso
Undeliverable as Addressed - Judgment of Bail/Bond Forfeiture.
Hearing on November 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ashley E Ottow in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.   Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Nathan S. from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State.  Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
